access_api_error_internal_server_error: Something went wrong during your request
app_launcher_config_description: When end users visit the Access App Launch page, they will be prompted to authenticate with your identity provider. Once logged in, the page will display a list of applications they can reach. You can control which users in your team can reach this page with the rule below.
app_launcher_empty_state_description: Configure your first rule to start seeing results here.
app_launcher_empty_state_doc: In the meantime, here's our {link} about the App Launcher.
app_launcher_section_description: Access App Launch is a portal that end users can visit to connect to applications behind Access with one-click. Configure who can use this portal here. Once configured, your portal can be found at <a href="%{authDomain}" target="__blank" > %{authDomain}<a/>
app_launcher_session_description: This will apply to all users of your App Launcher.
app_launcher_success_create: Successfully created an App Launcher configuration.
app_launcher_success_update: Successfully updated the App Launcher configuration.
auth_edit_modal_description: Changing your team domain can potentially break your application's authentication flow. Make sure you update the callback URL in all of your Identity provider configurations to your new team domain.
change_configuration_modal_description: You are about to change the configuration settings for your identity provider.
config_cancel_msg: You will lose any changes made to this App Launcher configuration.
confirm_idp_delete_description: Do you want to delete the identity provider %{providerName}?
edit_idp_client_secret_helper_text: This field is redacted for privacy and security purposes.
edit_idp_idp_metadata: Drop your file here or click to select a file
edit_idp_idp_metadata_desc: Drop or select IdP metadata XML file to upload
edit_idp_idp_metadata_error: We could not find the required information in your XML file. Try adding it manually.
edit_idp_idp_parse_cert_error: Unable to find the certificate information in your XML file under <KeyDescriptor>. Try adding it manually.
edit_idp_issuer_url: IdP Entity ID or Issuer URL
edit_idp_issuer_url_help: You can find this value in your SAML server configuration or in the metadata XML provider by your IdP.
edit_idp_name_help: Unique name to identify this identity provider in the login page.
edit_idp_oidc_claims_help: Add a list of custom claims that will be pulled from your id_token and added to your signed Access JWT token.
edit_idp_oidc_email_claim_help: The claim name for email in the id_token response.
edit_idp_oidc_pkce_desc: PKCE is an extension to the Authorization Code flow that prevents Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) and authorization code injection attacks. Only check this if your identity provider supports PKCE for confidential clients.
edit_idp_saml_attrs_help: Add a list of SAML attribute names that will be added to your signed JWT token and can be used in SAML policy rules.
edit_idp_saml_email_attr_help: The attribute name for email in the SAML response.
edit_idp_saml_header_attrs_help: Add a list of attribute names that will be returned in the response header from the Access callback.
edit_idp_saml_sign_auth_help: Sign the SAML authentication request with Access credentials. To verify the signature, use the public key from the Access certs endpoints.
edit_idp_signing_cert_help: X509 certificate to verify the signature in the SAML authentication response.
edit_idp_sso_url_help: URL to send the SAML authentication requests to.
edit_okta_api_token_help: Recommended for Okta organizations with more than 100 groups.
idp_add_success: Successfully added identity provider. Click "Test" to confirm.
idp_azure_ad_policy_sync_desc: Sync AzureAD Authentication Context policies for use in Access application policies. Cloudflare Access must have Authentication Context permissions in AzureAD.
idp_azure_ad_policy_sync_error: Failed to fetch Azure AD Authentication Context. Please make sure you have granted the correct API permissions.
idp_finish_setup_body: If you are the administrator of this identity provider, continue to <0>finish setup</0>.  If you are not the admin, copy the URL below and send to your administrator.
idp_name_too_long: Name must be shorter than %{maxExclusiveLen} characters
idp_support_groups_desc: Allow Zero Trust to collect group information about your users. The feature requires the Read All Groups permission in your list of Azure AD application permissions.
idp_update_error: There was an error while updating your identity provider
idp_update_success: Successfully updated identity provider. Click "Test" to confirm.
idps_limit_reached:
You've reached the maximum number
of identity providers allowed.
<0>Learn more
login_customisation_access_logo_sub: Show or hide the Cloudflare Access logo
login_customisation_custom_footer_sub: This text will be below your configured Identity Providers.
login_customisation_custom_header_placeh: eg. Sign in with your company email.
login_customisation_custom_header_sub: This text will be below your logo.
login_customisation_org_name_sub: This name is shared across all login screens.
login_customisation_subtitle: Users will see this page when attempting to visit an application that is behind Access.
login_methods_empty: No identity providers are currently configured.
must_have_pii_access_risk_score_sharing: You must have PII access to turn on Risk Score sharing.
name: Name
org_session_duration_subtitle: This will set the maximum session length for all of your applications.
risk_score_description: Share Risk Score with Okta. Configure additional actions in your Okta account. <0>Learn more</0>
risk_score_enabled: Risk Score is already enabled on another Okta tenant.
rule_invalid_error: There is an error with one or more of your rules. Reconfigure by selecting an invalid rule and try again.
rules_description: The rules saved here define who can reach the Access App Launch page. **This policy does not impact or change the permissions for any of the applications behind Access.**
rules_placeholder_any_valid_service_toke: Any non expired Service Token will be matched.
rules_placeholder_certificate: Any valid certificate will be matched.
scim_endpoint_modal_description: Copy and save this endpoint to configure SCIM in your identity provider. This is the endpoint that your IdP will push user and groups changes to via SCIM.
scim_group_sync_toggle_description: Requires a reauthentication of all Access and WARP sessions if a user's group membership is changed in your identity provider.
scim_seat_deprovisioning_toggle_descript: Removes billing seat from users who have been disabled or removed from your identity provider. User deprovisioning must be enabled.
scim_secret_modal_description: A unique SCIM secret has been generated for your account. The secret must be copied to your identity provider to begin provisioning.
scim_segret_regenerate_description: Continuing will generate a new SCIM secret for your account. The new secret must be updated with your identity provider.
scim_toggle_description: System for Cross-domain Identity Management (SCIM) allows for automatic synchronization of users and groups between your identity provider and Access.
scim_toggle_warning_desc: Turning off this setting removes all users and groups in SCIM storage.
scim_toggle_warning_title: Are you sure you want to turn off SCIM?
scim_user_deprovisioning_toggle_descript: Revoke access from users who have been disabled or removed from your identity provider. This will revoke all active Access and WARP sessions.
scim_user_group_sync_description: Determines how user information is updated from your identity provider. Changing your user group sync type will require reauthentication.
select_idp: Select an identity provider to add
team_domain_subtitle: Your team domain is unique to your Cloudflare account. This is where users will find the App Launcher.
team_domain_taken: This team name is already taken.
well_known_config_url_description: The Shared Signals Framework config address. This is copied to the receiving application.
